properties.Title: Ram head mug depicting symposium of the mythical kings of Athens
properties.Description Title: Ram head mug depicting symposium of the mythical kings of Athens
properties.Description Info:
signed by the potter Charinos, attributed to
the Triptolemos Painter, Greek,
Attic, c. 480 BCE. Terracotta,
red-figure technique, 22.5 × 14 ×
26.7 cm (8 7/8 × 5 1/2 × 10 1/2 in.). Virginia
Museum of Fine Arts, Richmond,
Adolph D. and Wilkins C.
Williams Fund, 79.100.
properties.Description Image Credits: Photo: Travis Fullerton © Virginia Museum of Fine Arts

properties.Title: Lion-headed mug depicting revelers
properties.Description Title: Lion-headed mug depicting revelers
properties.Description Info:
attributed to Douris, Greek, Attic, early 5th
century BCE. Terracotta, red figure
technique, height: 14.4 cm
(5 11 / 16 in.); diameter: 8.7 cm
(3 7/16 in.). Musée du Louvre, Paris,
H 65 (MNB 1294).
properties.Description Image Credits: © RMN-Grand Palais / Art Resource, NY

properties.Title: Amphora pitcher with zoomorphic handles
properties.Description Title: Amphora pitcher with zoomorphic handles
properties.Description Info:
Achaemenid, c. 480 BCE. Silver, partially gilded, height:
27 cm (10 5 / 8 in.); diameter
(rim): 13.4 cm (5 1 /4 in.); weight:
1,344 g. From the Kukova
Mogila at Duvanli (Bulgaria).
National Archaeological Institute
with Museum, Sofia, Bulgaria,
6137.
properties.Description Image Credits: © Photos: Krasimir Georgiev, National Archaeologial Institute with Museum at the Bulgarian Academy of Sciences

properties.Title: Ritual wine vessel in the form of a standing duck
properties.Description Title: Ritual wine vessel in the form of a standing duck
properties.Description Info:
Chinese, Warring States period,
probably 5th century BCE. Cast
bronze with gray-green patina,
20.5 × 17 × 30.8 cm (8 1/16 × 6 11/16 ×
12 1/8 in.). Harvard Art Museums /
Arthur M. Sackler Museum,
Anonymous gift, 1944.57.4.
properties.Description Image Credits: © President and Fellows of Harvard College

properties.Title: Relief from the Nereid Monument: Royal Banquet
properties.Description Title: Relief from the Nereid Monument: Royal Banquet
properties.Description Info:
Lycian, 390– 380 BCE. From Xanthos
(Turkey). The British Museum,
London, 1848,1020.97– 9
properties.Description Image Credits: © The Trustees of the British Museum. All rights reserved

properties.Title: Rhyton with the Forepart of a Griffin
properties.Description Title: Rhyton with the forepart of a griffin
properties.Description Info:
Achaemenid, 5th– 4th
century bce
Silver, partially gilded
Height: 23 cm (9 1/16 in.);
diameter: 13.4 cm
(5 1/4 in.); weight: 891 g
The British Museum, London,
Bequeathed by Sir Augustus
Wollaston Franks, 1897,1231.178
properties.Description Image Credits: © The Trustees of the British Museum. All rights reserved

properties.Title: Rhyton with the Forepart of a Ram
properties.Description Title: Rhyton with the forepart of a ram
properties.Description Info:
Achaemenid,
early to mid-5th century BCE.
Silver, 20 × 12 × 12.3 cm (7 7/8 ×
4 3/4 × 4 13/16 in.). Metropolitan
Museum of Art, New York, Gift
of Norbert Schimmel Trust, 1989,
1989.281.30.
properties.Description Image Credits: © The Metropolitan Museum of Art. Image source: Art Resource, NY

properties.Title: Shallow Bowl
properties.Description Title: Shallow bowl
properties.Description Info:
Achaemenid, 6th–4th century
BCE. Silver, height: 4.7 cm
(1 7/8 in.); diameter: 16.9 cm
(6 5/8 in.); weight: 280 g. Harvard
Art Museums/Arthur M. Sackler
Museum, Bequest of Frances L.
Hofer, 1979.357.
properties.Description Image Credits: © President and Fellows of Harvard College

properties.Title: Rhyton with the Forepart of a Wild Goat
properties.Description Title: Rhyton with the forepart of a wild goat
properties.Description Info:
Achaemenid,
5th– 4th century BCE.
Bronze, height: 24 cm (9 7/16 in.);
diameter: 10 cm (3 15/16 in.). Musée
du Louvre, Paris, AO 3115.
properties.Description Image Credits: © RMN-Grand Palais / Art Resource, NY

properties.Title: Rhyton with the Forepart in the Shape of a Lion with Prey
properties.Description Title: Rhyton forepart in the shape of a lion with prey
properties.Description Info:
Achaemenid, probably
Egyptian, 5th– 4th century BCE.
Faience, height: 10.5 cm (4 1/8 in.);
length: 15.5 cm (6 1/8 in.); width:
7 cm (2 3/4 in.). Musée du Louvre,
Paris, Collection Clot Bey, E 931.
properties.Description Image Credits: © Musée du Louvre, Dist. RMN-Grand Palais/George Poncet/Art Resource, NY

properties.Title: Horn-shaped rhyton with the head of a wild goat
properties.Description Title: Horn-shaped rhyton with the head of a wild goat
properties.Description Info:
Anatolian or Iranian, 5th
century BCE. Terracotta, length:
34.6 cm (13 5/8 in.); diameter:
10.9 cm (4 5/16 in.). From a tomb at
Deve Hüyük (Turkey). Ashmolean
Museum of Art and Archaeology,
University of Oxford, AN1913.636.
properties.Description Image Credits: © Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford

properties.Title: Rhyton with the Forepart of a Sphinx
properties.Description Title: Rhyton with the Forepart of a Sphinx
properties.Description Info:
Thracian, 380-360 BCE 
From Borovo (Bulgaria)
Gilt silver
20.3 x 24 x 10 cm (8 x 9 7/16 x 3 15/16 in.)
Rousse Regional Museum of History, II 358

properties.Title: Jug Rhyton
properties.Description Title: Jug Rhyton
properties.Description Info:
Thracian, 380-360 BCE
From Borovo (Bulgaria)
Gilt silver
H. 18.2 cm (7 3/16 in.)
Rousse Regional Museum of History, II 361

properties.Title: Bell krater depicting a symposium
properties.Description Title: Bell krater depicting a symposium
properties.Description Info:
attributed to the Philocleon Reverse Group, Greek,
Attic, c. 390 BCE. Terracotta, redfigure
technique, height: 34.5 cm
(13 9/16 in.); diameter: 34.9 cm
(13 3/4 in.). Kunsthistorisches
Museum, Vienna, ANSA IV 910.

properties.Title: Vessel in the form of an African youth in the clutches of a crocodile
properties.Description Title: Vessel in the form of an African youth in the clutches of a crocodile
properties.Description Info:
attributed
to the potter Sotades and in the
manner of the Sotades Painter,
Greek, Attic, c. 460 BCE. Terracotta
with polychrome and redfigure
decoration, 23 × 23 cm
(9 1 /16 × 9 1 /16 in.). From Capua
(Italy). Museum of Fine Arts,
Boston, Henry Lillie Pierce Fund,
98.881.
properties.Description Image Credits: © 2018 Museum of Fine Arts, Boston

properties.Title: Donkey Head Kantharos
properties.Description Title: Donkey head kantharos
properties.Description Info:
Greek,
Attic, 520– 500 BCE. Terracotta,
black-figure technique, height:
21.6 cm (8 ½ in.); diameter:
13.7 cm (5 3/8 in.). The British
Museum, London, 1876,0328.5
(B378).
properties.Description Image Credits: © The Trustees of the British Museum. All rights reserved

properties.Title: Donkey head mug
properties.Description Title:
Donkey head mug
Attributed to the Brygos Painter
properties.Description Info:
attributed to the Brygos
Painter, Greek, Attic, c. 480 BCE.
Terracotta, red-figure technique,
height: 25.4 cm (10 in.); diameter:
12 cm (4 3/4 in.). Museum of Fine
Arts, Boston, Francis Bartlett
Donation of 1900, 03.787.
properties.Description Image Credits: © 2018 Museum of Fine Arts, Boston

properties.Title: Donkey and Ram head mug depicting satyrs
properties.Description Title: Donkey and ram head mug depicting satyrs
properties.Description Info:
attributed to the Sotades Painter,
Greek, Attic, c. 450 BCE. Terracotta,
red-figure technique, 17.5 ×
11 × 11.7 cm (6 7/8 × 4 5/16 × 4 5/8 in.).
Walters Art Museum, Baltimore,
Museum purchase with funds
provided by the S. & A.P. Fund,
1952, 48.2050.
properties.Description Image Credits: © The Walters Art Museum, Baltimore

properties.Title: Eye Cup
properties.Description Title: Eye cup
properties.Description Info:
Greek,
Attic, c. 530 BCE. Terracotta,
black-figure technique, height:
11.7 cm (4 5/8 in.); diameter: 23 cm
(9 1/16 in.). Harvard Art Museums/
Arthur M. Sackler Museum,
Bequest of Joseph C. Hoppin,
1925.30.19.
properties.Description Image Credits: © President and Fellows of Harvard College

properties.Title: Eagle Head Cup
properties.Description Title: Eagle Head Cup
properties.Description Info:
Greek, Attic,
490– 470 BCE. Terracotta, redfigure
technique, height: 24.1 cm
(9 1/2 in.); diameter: 12.7 cm (5 in.).
From Capua (Italy). The British
Museum, London, 1873,0820.274
(E802).

properties.Title: Ram Head Mug depicting a symposium
properties.Description Title: Ram head mug depicting a symposium
properties.Description Info:
attributed
to the Syriskos Painter,
Greek, Attic, c. 480– 470 BCE.
Terracotta, red-f igure technique,
height: 21.5 cm (8 7/16 in.);
diameter (rim): 11.4 cm (4 1/2 in.).
From Capua (Italy). The British
Museum, London, 1873,0820.272
(E795).

properties.Title: Deer head rhyton depicting griffins attacking a bull
properties.Description Title: Deer head rhyton depicting griffins attacking a bull
properties.Description Info:
probably Black Sea
area, c. 350 BCE. Silver, partially
gilded, 18.8 × 10.4 cm (7 3/8 ×
4 1/16 in.). From the Golyamata
Mogila, Zlatinitsa (Bulgaria).
National Institute of Archaeology
with Museum, Sofia, Bulgaria,
8620.
properties.Description Image Credits: © Photos: Krasimir Georgiev, National Archaeologial Institute with Museum at the Bulgarian Academy of Sciences

properties.Title: Greave
properties.Description Title: Greave
properties.Description Info:
Thracian, c. 350 BCE.
Silver, gilded, 41.2 × 10 × 10 cm
(16 1/4 × 3 15/16 × 3 15/16 in.). From
the Golyamata Mogila, Zlatinitsa
(Bulgaria). National History
Museum, Sofia, Bulgaria, 50457.

properties.Title: Boar head mug depicting two banqueters
properties.Description Title: Boar head mug depicting two banqueters
properties.Description Info:
name vase of the Painter
of the Oxford Boar Head, Greek,
South Italian, Apulian, 4th
century BCE. Terracotta, redfigure
technique, height: 18 cm
(7 1 /16 in.); diameter: 10.5 cm
(4 1/8 in.). Ashmolean Museum of
Art and Archaeology, University
of Oxford, AN1885.638.
properties.Description Image Credits: © Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford

properties.Title: Griffin Head Mug
properties.Description Title: Griffin head mug
properties.Description Info:
Greek, South Italian, Apulian,
second half 4th century
BCE. Terracotta, height: 19.2 cm
(7 9/16 in.); diameter (rim): 8.9 cm
(31 /2 in.). From Ruvo (Italy).
Museum of Fine Arts, Boston,
Henry Lillie Pierce Fund, 00.361.
properties.Description Image Credits: © 2018 Museum of Fine Arts, Boston

properties.Title: Amphora depicting satyr with wineskin and drinking horn
properties.Description Title: Amphora depicting satyr with wineskin and drinking horn
properties.Description Info:
attributed to the Berlin Painter,
Greek, Attic, c. 490– 480 BCE.
Terracotta, red-figure technique,
height: 32.4 cm (12 3/4 in.); diameter
(mouth): 14.6 cm (5 3/4 in.).
Metropolitan Museum of Art,
New York, Rogers Fund, 1907,
07.286.69.

properties.Title: Pelike depicting Helen and Paris
properties.Description Title: Pelike depicting Helen and Paris
properties.Description Info:
attributed
to the Painter of Louvre G 539,
Greek, Attic, 420–400 BCE. Terracotta,
red-figure technique,
height: 28.6 cm (11 1/4 in.); diameter:

Art Museums/Arthur M. Sackler
Museum, Bequest of Joseph C.

properties.Title: Hero Relief
properties.Description Title: Hero relief
properties.Description Info:

Marble, 25 × 40 × 3 cm (9 13/16 ×
15 3/4 × 1 3/ 16 in.). Ashmolean

University of Oxford,
ANMichaelis.145.

properties.Title: Kantharos with the faces of mustachioed men
properties.Description Title: Kantharos with the faces of mustachioed men
properties.Description Info:
attributed
to the Osborne House Painter,
East Greek, probably Miletus,

(6 13/16 in.). Museum of Fine Arts,

98.925.
properties.Description Image Credits: © 2018 Museum of Fine Arts, Boston

properties.Title: Persepolis: amphora with zoomorphic handles
properties.Description Title:
Detail of a limestone
relief from the eastern stairway
of the Apadana at Persepolis
(Iran) showing an Armenian or
Parthian delegate carrying an
amphora pitcher with griffinshaped
handles
properties.Description Info:
Achaemenid,
c. 522– 486 BCE.
